chargeHist.descr: Battery or Threat to Judge, Prosecutor, or Law Enforcement Officer

result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Ronald Stace Higgins

records.addlTxt:
11:43 AM Defendant Ronald Stace Higgins in court.  Attorney Alysja Otten in court for Ronald Stace Higgins.  Attorney Jennifer Gross in court for State of Wisconsin. Court calls case and recites appearances. Atty Otten acknowledges information, waives reading. Atty Otten enters Not Guilty Plea on behalf of the DEF, DEF agrees. Court enters NG Plea to Count 1. Atty Otten requests for a Status Conference to be set. State does not object to setting a status conference. All parties agree, Court schedules. Next Court Appearance Card completed by Court Officer and given to DEF.
Status conference scheduled for January 24, 2023 at 11:00 am.
Status conference on January 24, 2023 at 11:00 am.
Supervision Report - Justice Point
Motion heard 9/19/22

SIBS $2500 with Cash Competent CBS $250  NO VIOLENT OR ABUSIVE CONTACT WITH  D.H.  (dob: 8/28/1958)   No Possession or use of firearms.  ABSOLUTE SOBRIETY/ No Possession or Consumption of Alcoholic Beverages.  May not possess any controlled substance or paraphernalia.     No drug use without a valid prescription and if prescribed must take as DR ordered.  

Defendant shall be subject to testing of their blood, breath, saliva and/or urine to ensure compliance with absolute sobriety provision. 9:37 AM Defendant Ronald Stace Higgins in court, in custody.  Attorney Alysja Otten in court for Ronald Stace Higgins.  Attorney Jennifer Gross in court for State of Wisconsin. Court calls case and recites appearances.  Attny Otten indicates to proceed with preliminary hearing.    State calls witness, Sawyer County Deputy Kevin Hagmann sworn in by court.   State begins examination.    9:39 AM  Witness identified the DEF, court indicates the record will reflect.  State continues examination.  9:43 AM  Cross-Examination by Attorney Otten.    9:44 AM Attny Otten no further questions.  9:44  AM  Witness excused.   No further witness by either party.   State request for bind over.  Attny Otten makes argument.  Court finds probable cause and binds defendant over for trial.  

Attny Otten makes bond modification request.   State has no objection to bond modification, though indicates some case necessary.   Court makes statement.   Court converts Cash bond to SIBS $2500 with Cash Competent CBS $250  NO VIOLENT OR ABUSIVE CONTACT WITH  D.H.  (dob: 8/28/1958)   No Possession or use of firearms.  ABSOLUTE SOBRIETY/ No Possession or Consumption of Alcoholic Beverages.  May not possess any controlled substance or paraphernalia.     No drug use without a valid prescription and if prescribed must take as DR ordered.  

Defendant shall be subject to testing of their blood, breath, saliva and/or urine to ensure compliance with absolute sobriety provision. Within 24 hours of release from custody (not including weekends/holidays) defendant shall report to Justice Point Pre-Trial Services at 10610 Main Street Suite 101, Hayward, WI 54843. Phone: 715-804-0109 OR 715-961-0149 for orientation and to establish testing procedures and options.
Arraignment scheduled for October 25, 2022 at 11:00 am.
Arraignment on October 25, 2022 at 11:00 am.

9:49 AM Defendant Ronald Stace Higgins in court, in custody.  Attorney Alysja Otten appeared by video for Ronald Stace Higgins.  Attorney Jennifer Gross in court for State of Wisconsin.  Court calls case and recites appearances.  Attny Otten indicates proper documents were obtained and DEF qualifies for PD appointment.   Attny Otten indicates to proceed with initial appearance.  DEF received copy of criminal complaint.  DEF verifies DOB and address. DEF advised of rights and penalties; DEF waives rights; parties stipulate to facts.   Court enters NG Plea to Counts 2-4.   Attny Otten requests preliminary hearing to be within time limits.   
Attny Otten makes oral motion for bond modification.   Court notes bond motion to be heard at preliminary hearing.
Preliminary hearing scheduled for September 19, 2022 at 09:15 am.
Preliminary hearing on September 19, 2022 at 09:15 am.

11:31 AM DE Ronald Higgins in court, appearing in custody by video from the Sawyer County Jail, with Atty Alysja Otten (special appearance) appears by video.  Jennifer Gross appeared in person for the State of WI.  Court calls case and recites appearances.  DE verifies DOB and Address.  DE possibly qualify for public defender, needs more information, Court gives the DEF the attorney colloquy.  Court finds probable cause.  State makes bond recommendation.  Victim, D.H. speaks to the court.  Atty Otten argues bond.  Court makes statement regarding bond.  Court sets bond.  Court gives the DE the attorney colloquy. Court sets INITIAL APPEARANCE for September 13, 2022 at 8:30AM.
